jpt.variables¶

© Copyright 2021, Mareike Picklum, Daniel Nyga.

Module Contents¶

class jpt.variables.Variable(name, domain, min_impurity_improvement=None)¶

Abstract class for a variable name along with its distribution class type.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the variable

  • domain (class type of jpt.learning.distributions.Distribution) – the class type (not an instance!) of the represented Distribution

  • min_impurity_improvement (float) –

dist(self, params=None, data=None, rows=None, col=None)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution type attached to this variable.

Either the distribution params can be passed or the data the distribution parameters are to be determined from.

_dist(self, params)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution associated with this type of variable.

class jpt.variables.NumericVariable(name, domain=Numeric, min_impurity_improvement=None, haze=None, max_std=None, precision=None)¶

Represents a continuous variable.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the variable

  • domain (class type of jpt.learning.distributions.Distribution) – the class type (not an instance!) of the represented Distribution

  • min_impurity_improvement (float) –

dist(self, params=None, data=None, rows=None, col=None)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution type attached to this variable.

Either the distribution params can be passed or the data the distribution parameters are to be determined from.

_dist(self, params)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution associated with this type of variable.

class jpt.variables.SymbolicVariable(name, domain, min_impurity_improvement=None)¶

Represents a symbolic variable.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the variable

  • domain (class type of jpt.learning.distributions.Distribution) – the class type (not an instance!) of the represented Distribution

  • min_impurity_improvement (float) –

dist(self, params=None, data=None, rows=None, col=None)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution type attached to this variable.

Either the distribution params can be passed or the data the distribution parameters are to be determined from.

_dist(self, params)¶

Create and return a new instance of the distribution associated with this type of variable.

jpt.variables.infer_from_dataframe(df, scale_numeric_types=True, min_impurity_improvement=None, haze=None, max_std=None, precision=None)¶

Creates the Variable instances from column types in a Pandas or Spark data frame.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – the data frame object to generate the variables from.

  • scale_numeric_types (bool) – Whether of not to use scaled types for the numeric variables.

  • min_impurity_improvement (float) – the minimum imrovement that a split must induce to be acceptable.

  • haze (float) –

  • max_std (float) –

  • precision (float in [0, 1]) –

class jpt.variables.VariableMap(data: List[Tuple] = None)¶

Convenience class for mapping a Variable object to anything else. This special map, however, supports accessing the image set both by the variable object instance itself _and_ its name.

data may be an iterable of (variable, value) pairs.
